intro: Jasminum mathildae, commonly known as the Mathilde jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its fragrant, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate with a glossy green surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
